Package tools.concurrent

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.concurrent.Scheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObsInterface<Scheduler,​SchedulerEventObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SchedulerSet, SelfScheduler, ThreadScheduler
    public abstract class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObsInterface<Scheduler,​SchedulerEventObject>
    Abstract class for task distribution handlers which can queue and execute tasks.
    A scheduled task can be executed at any point in time directly after invoking the scheduleTask(Runnable) function, and can be executed on any thread, including the current thread.
    Note that this implies that the task can be executed not only on one or more threads, but also directly after invoking, but not yet returning from the scheduleTask(Runnable) function and on the current thread.

    All functions of any scheduler implementation must be thread-safe.

    If a task throws an exception, the this exception must be logged using the Logger class.

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleTask

        public abstract void scheduleTask​(java.lang.Runnable task)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Schedules a task for execution.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to execute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the scheduler was not yet started or if it is terminated.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If task == null.
        See Also:
        start(), isStarted(), terminate(), isTerminated()

      • queueSize

        public abstract int queueSize()
        Returns:
        the queueSize of the current request queue.

      • start

        public abstract void start()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts the scheduler. This function only returns when the scheduler is started. This does mean that all initial configurations are done (i.e. tasks will be queued), but this does not mean that the first task will be processed directly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the scheduler was already started or terminated, or could not be started.
        See Also:
        terminate(), isStarted()

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Terminates the scheduler. After this call, no new tasks can be scheduled with this scheduler. A new instance has to be created to schedule new tasks. The scheduler will only finish tasks it already started, but not tasks which were added to the queue but not yet started.

        Blocks until the scheduler has terminated completely.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the scheduler was already terminated.
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        See Also:
        terminate(long, TimeUnit), forceTerminate(), isTerminated()

      • terminate

        public abstract boolean terminate​(long timeout,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit tu)
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Terminates the scheduler.
        After this call, no new tasks can be scheduled with this scheduler, even if the call results in false. A new instance has to be created to schedule new tasks. The scheduler will only finish tasks it already started, but not tasks which were added to the queue but not yet started.

        Blocks until either the scheduler has terminated completely or the timeout has passed.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The time to wait at most before returning.
        tu - The time unit of timeout.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler is terminated. false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.
        See Also:
        terminate(), forceTerminate(), isTerminated()

      • forceTerminate

        public void forceTerminate()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Forcefully terminates the scheduler. If a task is being executed, then it will be interrupted.

        Blocks until the scheduler has terminated completely.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.
        See Also:
        terminate(), terminate(long, TimeUnit), isTerminated()

      • tryTerminate

        public boolean tryTerminate()
        Tries to terminate the scheduler without waiting. If this is not possible, then the termination process will be invoked, but not on the current thread.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler could be terminated without waiting. false otherwise.

      • isStarted

        public abstract boolean isStarted()
        Checks whether the scheduler is started.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler is started. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isTerminated(), isActive()

      • isTerminated

        public abstract boolean isTerminated()
        Checks whether the scheduler is terminated.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler is terminated. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isStarted(), isActive()

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks whether the scheduler is active.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduler accepts tasks. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isStarted(), isTerminated()

      • isDone

        public abstract boolean isDone()
        Checks whether the scheduler has no more tasks left.
        Returns:
        true if there are no tasks in the queue and no task is being executed. Undefined when isTerminated() == true. false otherwise.

      • waitUntilDone

        public abstract void waitUntilDone()
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until the entire queue is empty. This function will also return when the scheduler is terminated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the current thread was interrupted.

      • forceNotifyObservers

        public void forceNotifyObservers()
        Forces the notification of the observers.
        The modification flag is not checked nor modified, and all observers are notified regardles.
